newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean shares end lower, power sector weak.
newsitem.headline: Chilean shares end lower, power sector weak.

text.p: Chilean blue chips ended lower with electricity shares among the leading decliners, said traders.
The market is seen opening slightly weaker although turnover will be light due to Wall Street's closure for the Thanksgiving Day holiday, they said.
The 40-share IPSA index closed down 0.43 percent at 93.93 points. The general IGPA index shed 0.73 percent at 5,139.32 points amid turnover of nearly 12 billion pesos.
Traders said there was no clear reason for Wednesday's fall, which dragged stocks through the previous support level of 94 points.
"There is no fundamental reason for the fall. I don't think it is justified, as Chilean stocks are already very cheap," said Pablo Salcedo, head of research at ING Barings.
Electricity shares continued to slide on fears over the impact of a drought on fourth quarter earnings of hydro- electric generating firms, said traders.
Low water levels in their dams mean these producers are having to buy high-cost power from other thermal generators.
Endesa, Chile's largest hydro-power producer, ended off 1.26 percent at 235/34 pesos.
Traders said a widely expected sharp cut in power distribution prices has already been factored into electricity stock prices.
An announcement of the new power rates has been delayed by a legal dispute between the government and distributor Chilectra over the method of calculating the new prices.
Winners included winery Concha y Toro, up 0.52 percent at 194-1/2 pesos, and brewery CCU, which rose 0.32 percent to 1,580 pesos.
